title: pad_tokenize
description: Tokenize and pad a batch of data for scGPT integration zero-shot inference or fine-tuning.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input h5mu file of pre-processed data
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input h5mu file of pre-processed data.

model_vocab.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Path to model vocabulary file
model_vocab.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Path to model vocabulary file.

var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the .var column containing gene names. When no gene_name_layer is provided, the .var index will be used.

var_input.description: Type: `string`, default: `id_in_vocab`. The name of the adata
var_input.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `id_in_vocab`. The name of the adata.var column containing boolean mask for vocabulary-cross checked and/or highly variable genes.

input_obsm_binned_counts.description: Type: `string`, default: `binned_counts`. The name of the
input_obsm_binned_counts.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `binned_counts`. The name of the .obsm field containing the binned counts to be padded and tokenized.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The output h5mu file containing obsm arrays for gene tokens, tokenized data and padding mask
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The output h5mu file containing obsm arrays for gene tokens, tokenized data and padding mask.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression type for the output file
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression type for the output file.

obsm_gene_tokens.description: Type: `string`, default: `gene_id_tokens`, example: `values.pt`. The key of the
obsm_gene_tokens.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `gene_id_tokens`, example: `values.pt`. The key of the .obsm array containing the gene token ids

obsm_tokenized_values.description: Type: `string`, default: `values_tokenized`. The key of the
obsm_tokenized_values.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `values_tokenized`. The key of the .obsm array containing the count values of the tokenized genes

obsm_padding_mask.description: Type: `string`, default: `padding_mask`. The key of the
obsm_padding_mask.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `padding_mask`. The key of the .obsm array containing the padding mask.

pad_token.description: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. Token used for padding
pad_token.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. Token used for padding.

pad_value.description: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token
pad_value.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token.

max_seq_len.description: Type: `integer`. The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data
max_seq_len.help_text: Type: `integer`. The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data. Defaults to the number of features if not provided.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
